name: GELATIN
breadcrumbs: 9.2.2 Parenteral preparations for fluid and electrolyte imbalance
cautions:
Cautions 
(From Plasma substitutes: British National Formulary)
Cautions Plasma substitutes should be used with caution in patients with cardiac disease, severe liver disease, or renal impairment; urine output should be monitored. Care should be taken to avoid haematocrit concentration from falling below 25–30% and the patient should be monitored for hypersensitivity reactions.
